intro: Crinum brevistylum, commonly known as the short-stemmed glory lily, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or yellow. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its lance-shaped, strap-like leaves. Crinum brevistylum thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can be found in gardens and botanical collections.
